data.headline: S&P 500 gained 0.5%, Nasdaq rose 0.9%, Dow added 0.1%, and Russell 2000 advanced 0.8% as investors cautiously extended Friday’s AI-driven rally.
bullets: Tech and software stocks remained under pressure due to hedge fund shorting, CTA-driven weakness, and persistent AI concerns.
Monday.com plunged after issuing soft guidance and warning of disruption risks.
Hims & Hers Health sank following an FDA-scrutinized GLP-1 halt and a lawsuit from Novo Nordisk.
Small caps saw volatile moves, with UOKA, Kyndryl, and Pagaya active after Kyndryl’s CFO exit and accounting review.
Kroger climbed on news of a new CEO, while Eli Lilly rose after announcing a deal with Orna Therapeutics.
10-year Treasury yields hovered near 4.23%, the dollar softened, gold rebounded above $2,500, and bitcoin slipped below $69,000 on light volumes.
